Class ModifyProductFormController

java.lang.Object
com.fakeco.inventorysys.ModifyProductFormController
public class ModifyProductFormController extends Object
This controls the Modify product menu.

  • Constructor Details

    • ModifyProductFormController

      public ModifyProductFormController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      This is the initialize method for this controller. This function automatically runs when the screen is loaded. It is used here set up some information about the Product that needs to be modified and fill out the associated parts table. Additionally, Platform.runlater is called. This method is built in to Run a specified runnable at some unspecified time in the future. This provides time for the screen to load before a listener is set on a windows event - in this case, clicking on the x in the top right corner.

    • setListener

      public void setListener()
      This function sets a listener on a WindowsEvent. This listener is set on the current stage to gather close requests, which comes from the x in the top right corner. Instead of closing the window, the event is consumed, and instead the program is redirected to return to the main screen. This had to be run after the screen is loaded and so it relies on Platform.runlater.

    • receiveData

      public static void receiveData(Product p)
      This function is called from another class to pass a particular piece of data. Here is takes in a Product object and sets the local variable.
      Parameters:
      p - The Product passed from another class.

    • associatePart

      @Deprecated public void associatePart(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Deprecated.
      This associates a part with a product. It adds the associated part to the ObservableList that is tracking associated parts. If no part is selected, it prompts the user to select a part
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - button click

    • searchByPart

      public void searchByPart(javafx.event.Event event)
      This function allows the user to search for a Part and return the found values in the appropriate table. The function first creates an ObservableList using the text of the search field to find all Parts that have matched names, even if the name is incomplete. If that list returns nothing, the function tried to match via ID number. It displays on the table matched parts.
      Parameters:
      event - the triggering user event

    • showAlert

      public void showAlert(String alertText)
      This method shows an alert based on the passed string text.
      Parameters:
      alertText - the text used for the alert

    • cancelHandler

      @Deprecated public void cancelHandler(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Deprecated.
      This method sends the user back to the main menu.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - button click
      Throws:
      IOException - IOexception

    • saveHandler

      @Deprecated public void saveHandler(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Deprecated.
      This is the save function for a modified product. First it finds the index of where the modified product occurs in the ObservableList of all products. Then it checks if the min/max and inventory values are appropriate and returns an alert if not. It then checks if the product is outsourced or inhouse and tries to update the product as is appropriate. Field types are checked by parsing and if an error is thrown an alert is shown. It then updates the Observable List of all products and returns the main menu.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - button click

    • removeAssociatedPart

      @Deprecated public void removeAssociatedPart(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Deprecated.
      This function dissassociates a part from a product. It uses a selected product, checks with the user that they want to remove the part fromt he product and then removes the part from the product. If a product is not selected, the user is prompted to select one.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - button click

    • minMaxCheck

      public boolean minMaxCheck(int mid, int min, int max)
      This method checks that an inventory value is less than or equal to a maximum and greater than or equal to a minimum.
      Parameters:
      max - max value
      min - min value
      mid - mid value
      Returns:
      boolean if the check passes

    • confirmationAlert

      public boolean confirmationAlert(String alertText)
      This method shows a confirmation alert based on the passed string text.
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      whether the action is confirmed
